content.question: A random sample of <math alttext="n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> people selected from a large population will be asked whether they have read a novel in the past year. Let the random variable <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the number of people from the sample who answer yes. The variance of random variable <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is 6. Assume the responses are independent of each other. If the proportion of people from the population who read a novel in the past year is 0.40, which of the following is the best interpretation of random variable <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: A binomial variable with 15 independent trials
A binomial variable with 25 independent trials
A variable that is not binomial with 25 independent trials
A binomial variable with 40 independent trials
A variable that is not binomial with 40 independent trials

content.answer: A binomial variable with 25 independent trials
